name: Ariva MS Salute Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were booked into the Majestic Salute by our tour company (Buffalo Tours , by the way, which was outstanding!). We had three brief stays there, before and after trips to Sapa and Ha Long Bay. We had a different room for each stay. All our rooms were interior rooms, with a window onto an air shaft. This made for a quieter room, and we were only in the room briefly during the day. While our first room was fairly small (as another reviewer mentioned), our other two rooms were more spacious. The bath seemed just fine, and we did have hooks for our pjs. Nice bed linens, good toiletries provided, both a refrigerator and a safe provided in the room.
reviews.title: Great little hotel -- attentive staff

reviews.text: The location was outstanding -- so very convenient, in the heart of old Hanoi. We had fun exploring the 36 streets, wandering down to the lake, shopping and shopping some more, and eating at the nearby restaurants.
reviews.title: Oasis in the Heart of the Old Quarter

description: With the French style greeting and its marvelous architecture, the newly built Majestic Salute is a majestic boutique hotel located in the old quarter consisting of 36 streets of which the street names reflect the business one conducted there: Silk Street, Rice Street, Paper Street and so forth. The moment you arrive at the 5-story French style premises, you feel and taste the excitement of the city, the friendliness of Hanoi's distinctive charm stems from its architectural inheritance.
